name: MauiCheck
help: A dotnet tool for helping set up your .NET MAUI environment.

properties.name: Manifest
properties.help: Manifest files are currently used by the doctor to fetch the latest versions and requirements. The manifest is hosted by default at: https://aka.ms/dotnet-maui-check-manifest. Use this option to specify an alternative file path or URL to use.

properties.name: Fix
properties.help: You can try using the <c>--fix</c> argument to automatically enable solutions to run without being prompted.

properties.name: NonInteractive
properties.help: If you're running on CI you may want to run without any required input with the <c>--non-interactive</c> argument. You can combine this with <c>--fix</c> to automatically fix without prompting.

properties.name: Preview
properties.help: This uses a more frequently updated manifest with newer versions of things more often. The manifest is hosted by default at: https://aka.ms/dotnet-maui-check-manifest-dev

properties.name: Ci
properties.help: Uses the <c>dotnet-install</c> powershell / bash scripts for installing the dotnet SDK version from the manifest instead of the global installer.

properties.name: Skip
properties.help: Skips a checkup by name or id as listed in maui-check list. NOTE: If there are any other checkups which depend on a skipped checkup, they will be skipped too.

properties.name: DotNetVersion
properties.help: Use the SDK version in the manifest in global.json.

properties.name: DotNetRollForward
properties.help: Change the rollForward value in global.json to one of the allowed values specified.

properties.name: NuGetSources
properties.help: Adds the nuget sources specified in the manifest to the NuGet.config and creates the file if needed.
